job_description: Business Objects Analyst - job post RIVET OPERATIONS CO. San Diego, CA Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time JOB DESCRIPTION JOB DESCRIPTION Position Title: Business Object Enterprise (BoE) Analyst Location: San Diego, CA Duration: Long term contract Security Clearance: Must possess a DOD Secret clearance The Analyst shall assess and optimize the Business Intelligence (BI) environment to support information discovery, integration and sharing of information. The Analyst shall define measures, metrics, dashboards and support analytical architecture necessary to monitor, manage and support sound decisions for the enterprise data environment. The Analyst shall analyze the business processes and develop models for subsequent use; develop data models in support of the various applications required. Further, the Analyst shall review documented requirements and present specific design recommendations to address the business and data requirements in terms of viability and impact on existing and new processes. The Analyst shall identify required data elements; define associated metadata and sources to support these and any requirements. The Analyst must be able to communicate these requirements fluently to Government and other personnel (Knowledge Transfer). The Analyst shall support the Business Objects Enterprise community. The Analyst shall have up-to-date training to meet Cybersecurity requirements to include but not limited to Security+ and Certified Business Intelligence Professional. The Business Objects Enterprise Analyst shall; Contribute to all technical aspects of building and maintaining Business Objects data warehouse Create technical specifications for data conversion of Discoverer and Oracle reports to BOE Interface with Data Modeler to build warehouse and tables for supplemental data Review effectiveness of interfaces for accuracy and proper timing with ETL team Develop Universes, and coordinated changes with other Universe Designers Add definitions and source data to all elements of Universes Coordinate efforts with Programmers to write/test scripts for mass data clean-up projects Create, test and monitor reports and charts for local and Enterprise users Research problems using SQL to determine correct source for resolution Process all levels of Life Cycle Management documentation Summary: Reporting to the Business Intelligence Center of Excellence for the FRC, this BI and Reporting role will oversee data and reporting for FRC operations and collaborate with senior leadership to provide analytical support of data-driven decision making. This person will also work closely with key executives and stakeholders to deliver essential reporting and data, while providing a vision for enhancing data driven, evidence-based decisions at executive, managerial, and operations levels. JOB REQUIREMENTS JOB REQUIREMENTS Education and Experience: Bachelor Degree (data science, cognitive science, computer science, engineering, psychology) 5+ years in demonstrated leadership roles managing complex reporting and BI platforms 7+ years of full lifecycle data warehousing experience Experience with SAP BOE and at least one other industry-leading business intelligence platforms, such as Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Cognos, DOMO, or similar modern in-memory BI solution. Strong technical knowledge of data management systems, data modeling, database design, data quality, and data governance Must have significant experience in data warehousing, data visualization, and business intelligence Preferred education in User-Centered Design, Human Computer Interaction or UX Design Required Skills: Ability to create and modify reports using the Business Objects BI4 Ability to crate and modify reports using the Crystal Reports XI Ability to create and modify Dashboards using the Business Objects BI4 tools (Xcelsius) Experience in providing Mobile Dashboard Solutions Ability to create and modify new and existing report using Crystal Reports XI Ability to perform End User trainings and assist with the development of online training Mentor development teams in universe and report design, development and implementation Knowledge of Data Warehouse data modeling principles and techniques (Kimball is preferred) Ability to comprehend and develop complex SQL /PLSQL in an Oracle environment Support troubleshooting of issues within the Business Intelligence environment Employed vast knowledge of relational database concepts and Oracle PL/SQL coding to produce BOE reports and IDT universes. Developed and generated ad-hoc and customized reports in BOE/IDT to evaluate specific business requirements for the COMFRC enterprise. Analyzed data in the datamart and in BOE reports to identify root causes of problems and recommend corrective actions. Collaborated with system architects, data modelers and others to understand COMFRC and industry requirements. Monitored resolution of bugs, tested fixes and helped report developers tackle ongoing problems. Converted and Migrated Reports/BO Universes to support NERP effort Worked with Scrum team to test and certify BOE reports and data modeling changes before deploying to production. Operated under Agile and Scrum frameworks to complete releases and well-organized sprints. Cultivated interpersonal skills by building positive relationships with others. Tool-set used on site: SAP Business Intelligence (Business Objects) Oracle SQL /PLSQL TOAD and SQLNavigator Informatica (ETL Tool) CA Erwin (Data Modeling tool) Physical Requirements Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Position may require typing and reading from a computer screen. Must have sufficient mobility, including but not limited to bending, reaching, and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner. There is a possibility that due to parking availability and location of work, walking moderate to long distance may be required. Possible lifting up to 25 lbs. Please note: Rivet Operations Company LLC reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Positions functions and qualifications may vary depending on business needs. Rivet Operations Company LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, creed, religion, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status or legally protected characteristics.
